title: Sonic the Hedgehog 2
description: After settling in Green Hills, Sonic is eager to prove he has what it takes to be a true hero. His test comes when Dr. Robotnik returns, this time with a new partner, Knuckles, in search for an emerald that has the power to destroy civilizations. Sonic teams up with his own sidekick, Tails, and together they embark on a globe-trotting journey to find the emerald before it falls into the wrong hands.

reviews.text: What it changes from the games’ lore (like Knuckles’ relationship with the Master Emerald) wouldn’t be an issue if it were a better movie on its own. Like the first film, it stops short of fully developing the drama it’s going for, as though it’s apathetic towards its own story.

Sadly worse than the first one.Cons:Half of the movie is made of predictable cheap gag like: Fart jokes, funny music montage (with notorious, abused, songs), dance scenes, doormat evil henchmen gag, raging girl meme ...so annoying.Pros:Lots of Sonic 2 videogame references, good fx, Sonic & Tails & Knuckles & Robotnik have lots of screen time.Videogame movie are becoming a thing, with good success. Saldy this isn't one of them. Watch the first one instead.

Sonic 1 was a great movie and Sonic 2 is even better than the first. While the beginning feels a tiny bit slow and in a few parts isn't keeping up with the 1st, once eggman and knuckles show up the movie never has a low point again. Exploring some fun with Sonic and Tails establishing their friendship and giving us some spins on the background for tails and knuckles. The movies action feels on par or better than what marvel has been putting out.  The voice cast does a fantastic job again and the writers do an amazing job with bringing these characters to life and playing up their known personalities and then some. I've been wanting to get to theater to see it a second time, but this will be a day 1 purchase when it goes on blu-ray.The film was exciting, fun to watch, a lot of characters from the 1st make cameos or reappearances and I'm hoping they do a third.Honorable Mention: Knuckles is a FANTASTIC character and has some of the best lines in the entire movie. They did such a great job with him!

Amazing movie. I’ve been a Sonic fan since I was 5 years old and both this and the first movie have been interesting and brilliant, becoming part of my favourite movies of all time.The characters, story, cinematography and everything else is outstanding! I won’t say much else, but you should go and see it!

As a Sonic fan who was unable to enjoy the first one, this sequel definitely is an improvement, a small one however, Sonic as a character is simply not as a funny as the writers intend  (simply spouting pop culture references is not comedy) and neither feels as both cokcy and inspiring as the source material version of Sonic while Knuckles, Tails and Knuckles are elevated versions of their game counterparts, they feel like more tangible characters and there was a good job on adapting them to this medium while sadly, Sonic remains simply a worst version of his counterpart. This movie also released barely over 2 years after the one and it shows,the script needed more time in the oven, the pacing is very clunky and there's a point where TOO many things happen for the sake of convenience or for exposition purposes. The most definitive improvement over the first one is how the movie looks, while making these movies live action/animation hybrid instead of fully animated was definitely a mistake that holds them back, when the movie goes fully into the territory of the game's visuals it reaches its best and most exciting moments.

Lots of fun warching it!!  Fun for kids and adults as it has great pop culture zingers and even a portion dedicated to making the adult and kid viewer laugh. Only wished they went with using the animals being forced into becoming machines.  Be aware there will be a Sonic 3!!

The last act it's the best last Boss fight feel a movie can be. Awesome time and great movie saw it 2x.

As an old school Sonic fan, the easter eggs is what made this movie watchable. The plot would of been ok, if only it didn't feel like it was written by a 10 year old for a 5 year old. The dialogue was soo cringey I felt ill. The CGI looks like it's from the late 90's early 2000. Jim Carrey's performance is great, though sometimes he's more Jim Carrey, not enough Robotnic, making the character appear as less of a threat.If you're a Sonic fan, you'll find something to enjoy here. Just don't set your expectations high and you might not regret wasting 2 hours of your life.If you like cute little furry characters, flashy stuff and elaborate stories give you a headache. You'll love this movie!
Just like the first, but bigger! If you enjoyed number one, you’ll like this - plenty of fan service, and even the uninitiated 11 year old loved it!

“Sonic the Hedgehog 2” was a blast to watch and it was even more entertaining than the first movie.  You can tell that the people who worked on the film did their homework and know the franchise enough to deliver a fun movie for long time fans and casuals a like to enjoy.  I can say with confidence that the Sonic movies are the best movies based on a videogames series (Though, I’m not sure that’s saying a lot.)If there was one thing I didn’t like about the movie, it would be all the stuff involving the Non-Sonic characters.  It just felt like they existed to stretch out the length time a bit and they didn’t contribute all that much.  Don’t forget to stick around for the mid-credits scene, it will BLOW YOU AWAY!I hope you bring you’re A-game, untitled Illumination Mario film, cuz the “Sonic the Hedgehog” movies have the bar set nice and high for ya!

The story was about as good as the first film. There's plenty of fan service and enough content for casual fans as well. The play between Sonic and Knuckles was really well done. Overall, just a fun film for the family. Jim Carrey knocks it out of the park again as Robotnik/Eggman. The CG looks a little low budget at times but still holds up quite well.
Absolutely loved this movie such a great homage to the games. Campy but heart warming.

Sonic the Hedgehog 2 improves on Sonic the Hedgehog in almost every way. The action is snappier, the story grander, and the usage of source material is incredibly exhilarating. (Those who have seen the mid-credits scene will know what I mean.) The only problems I can find are the strange pacing and lacklustre comedy. While the first problem can be chalked up to the director not being used to the longer runtime, the comedy just isn't as good as the first film's. Which wasn't really that good outside of Jim Carrey's performance and a few other scenes. But, all of the problems can quickly be looked past if you enjoy the story, characters and exciting atmosphere of the film - which I think you will.

An awesome movie to enjoy with the whole family and a video game movie that we as fans have been waiting for a very, very, long time.  I enjoyed Sonic the Hedgehog 2, I have to say more than the first Sonic movie. My kids enjoyed it and for my kids to sit thru 2hrs straight without moving around just shows how much they enjoyed the movie.Now there are some down moments in this movie that I have to say was a bit unnecessary, like cringey jokes that didn't really land to well and other scenes in the movie that if they were edited out wouldn't make a difference to the movie at all.But all in all despite the few bad jokes and unnecessary scenes it didn't ruin the movie at all. In conclusion this is a great movie for everyone, families and Sonic fans alike.  It is worth seeing and I can't wait for another sequel. 9/10.
This sequel is bigger, better and closer to the source material than the first movie. When it comes to video game movies it doesn't get much better than this.

This is a masterpiece in my eyes of a sonic fan. It has tons of references and does the characters justice after so long of awful writing from sega and pontaff. However even if you aren't a sonic fan I feel like you'll still enjoy this movie. It has good action, good effects and some pretty decent and heartwarming writing. I don't understand how anyone can dislike this movie, especially since most of the bad reviews don't give any reasoning as to why it's bad. But for me, this is peak video game movies and I'm SUPER excited for sonic 3. ❤️

Sonic 2 increases the scale and stakes from the first, allowing for more set pieces and epic action sequences, but I still mostly found myself bored and uninterested. While I do think that this film successfully accomplishes what it sets out to do, and kids will absolutely love it, it's incredibly familiar and formulaic. Weak jokes and inconsistent CGI with a bloated runtime that drags. Your enjoyment of this one will largely depend on how much you enjoyed the first instalment; personally, I thought this was a step down from the already mediocre first.

i don't normally review films but i felt like i had to just for this. i've loved sonic ever since i was young and to see him being brought to life in these live action films has just been so amazing! my expectations were quite low for this sequel as the first one didn't impress me as much (but i still enjoyed it), however this film blew me away with how good it actually ended up being! i love the character designs and the characters themselves, i feel like they were done right. idris elba did a brilliant job at portraying knuckles and i'm so glad they decided to bring in coleen to voice tails like she does in the games! i'm enjoying the direction these films are headed in and cannot wait to see what they do with the third one! i definitely recommend you go see this film, sonic fan or not, as i had probably one of the best experiences i've ever had in the cinema watching sonic the hedgehog 2!
